coggame
Class Algorithms

java.lang.Object
  coggame.Algorithms

public class Algorithms
extends java.lang.Object

Algorithms contains a collection of miscellaneous algorithms and utility routines useful for game engines.

Method Detail

skyline

public static void skyline(TiledLayer layer,
                           int[] fill,
                           int[] left,
                           int[] right,
                           int[] top)
Fill a provided TiledLayer with a procedurally generated skyline. Tiles are randomly selected from the lists provided.

Parameters:
layer - the TiledLayer to fill.
fill - tile indices for solid regions of the skyline
left - tile indices for left edges of the skyline
right - tile indices for right edges of the skyline
top - tile indices for the top edge of the skyline

path

public static java.util.List<int[]> path(TiledLayer layer,
                                         int xStart,
                                         int yStart,
                                         int xGoal,
                                         int yGoal,
                                         boolean useDiagonal)
Find a path from a starting location in a TiledLayer to a given goal location. Nonzero tiles are considered impassable, for consistency with how sprite collision deals with TiledLayers. Returns a sequence of pairs of coordinates representing absolute tile positions. If no path is found, returns null.

Parameters:
layer - the TiledLayer to search
xStart - the x-position of the starting tile
yStart - the y-position of the starting tile
xGoal - the x-position of the goal tile
yGoal - the y-position of the goal tile
useDiagonal - should we consider diagonal movement as well as orthogonal?
